data.text:
From increased domestic violence to unplanned pregnancies, the #COVID19 pandemic is having a dramatic impact on women & girls globally. 

Update from @UNFPA: https://t.co/YEX0uH2Qyt https://t.co/X0ga0lN5cc

The #COVID19 pandemic has inspired people to join together in the face of a common enemy. 

See how the world has united in solidarity in this @Twitter moment.

https://t.co/5GI64JgEB6

"These are dark days, but they are not without hope.

We have a rare and short window of opportunity to rebuild our world for the better." 
- @antonioguterres on #ClimateAction and #COVID19 recovery at #PCD11 https://t.co/Ra9m6A7IkO

Millions of women worldwide are part of the essential workforce on the front lines of #COVID19.

See some their inspiring stories on Tuesday's World Day for Safety & Health at Work. #safeday2020 via @UN_Women

https://t.co/1sheZ9l0wL

It's #WorldImmunizationWeek. 

During emergencies like #COVID19, risk of outbreaks of diseases such as measles & polio increases.

#VaccinesWork to help keep us safe, keep us out of hospitals & protect our health workers. https://t.co/IbHwdHTJHM

 https://t.co/08QPRXAzFu

Women leaders from around the world are lending their voices & solutions to the new #RiseForAll solidarity campaign in response to #COVID19. 

See what they're saying in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/BmRze2bwuq

The UN & partners are working to cushion the economic impact of #COVID19 on small island countries, which are already grappling with the effects of the climate crisis.
https://t.co/KtiKtFcVKP

On Tuesday's Safety & Health at Work Day, we salute the courage, commitment and heroic efforts of all workers on the front lines of the global fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/2ZpFn8zKFX https://t.co/Kz3jNgbm0r

"The world cannot afford a lost generation of youth, their lives set back by #COVID19 and their voices stifled by a lack of participation." 

-- @antonioguterres at Security Council meeting on youth, peace & security. https://t.co/CYVBlewEOK https://t.co/CN5nCovzb6

Frontline workers are the heroes of the global #COVID19 pandemic response. 

We must ensure their safety and health at work. via @ILO https://t.co/er8oWdMfqq

"It is time for us to rise as women leaders taking action to conquer the pandemic & come out stronger."

-- @AminaJMohammed at launch of the Women #RiseForAll solidarity initiative. https://t.co/UCpunbpkUy https://t.co/c1YhN6EXJU

"The public health emergency risks becoming a human rights disaster, with negative effects that will long outlast the pandemic itself."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet https://t.co/fAY3HRLII6 https://t.co/hOdwbW8BDM

Radio is an indispensable tool for providing timely & accurate information. This is especially true during the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Here's how @UN_MINUSMA's radio station @mikadofm is helping keep people safe.

https://t.co/HoqzkiarIi

Religious leaders across Africa are joining the fight against #COVID19 by turning to television, radio & online broadcasts to show solidarity & support the #coronavirus response. https://t.co/ZXKdrj9vHe via @WHOAFRO https://t.co/efqeUyCmXp

Sanitation & hygiene play an important role in preventing the spread of diseases like #COVID19.  Yet, three billion people lack access to even basic hand washing facilities at home. 

Here's how @UNHABITAT is helping amid the pandemic: https://t.co/kH21LEyTBW https://t.co/kW1lbatAoM

Remittances are a crucial lifeline for many people around the world, particularly amid the #COVID19 crisis.

The @WorldBank stresses the essential need for money transfer services to continue operating during the pandemic.

https://t.co/QoxFPzPFFL

Despite the #COVID19 pandemic, @WFP_UNHAS continues flights to 20+ destinations across Afghanistan - ensuring aid workers & supplies can be delivered to communities working to fight #coronavirus.

More about their lifesaving work: https://t.co/1giHs26NbF https://t.co/awFVVUMwTv
The beauty of nature can provide comfort in times of crisis. More stress reduction tips here: https://t.co/LsrxBWUuaN https://t.co/8XaGI9wtAP

As the world tackles #COVID19, the climate crisis is not on hold.

Delaying #ClimateAction could cause significantly higher costs in the future.

Find out how you can #ActNow from home: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV via @UNFCCC https://t.co/5SRPbqr5RO

From helping to develop vaccines against #COVID19 to providing masks and medical equipment, the UN continues its work around to world to help countries tackle the #coronavirus crisis. 

https://t.co/Cc7raNe9ll

3100+ cases of measles have been reported in North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, since January.

During #WorldImmunizationWeek, @UNICEF explains how they're safely carrying out critical vaccination campaigns, despite #COVID19. #VaccinesWork

https://t.co/fSh6HSRtjj

People all over the 🌎 can get real-time, accurate information about #COVID19 directly from @WHO through @Whatsapp.

Here's how: https://t.co/Usb6mypIQ2 https://t.co/c2W3bw4GPL

The world's least developed countries are particularly vulnerable to the effects of the #COVID19 pandemic. 

@UNCDF is providing guidance to countries on how to ensure resources are channeled to those most in need. https://t.co/h2mVnHT8Af https://t.co/lzYikYmzGp

Science is key to understanding our world, from pandemics like #COVID19 to the causes of the climate emergency.

To find the best solutions for our present and our future, our response to these crises must be led by scientific facts. https://t.co/ERiNoGq0eJ https://t.co/HXvDYv7BXe

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, each one of us can show solidarity and #FightRacism and intolerance. https://t.co/QpwavXBwfu https://t.co/l40wrWtmQA

More than ever, the world needs professional journalism & reliable information to fight #COVID19 and counter the spread of misinformation.

@UNESCO is supporting the media to improve access to information on the pandemic. https://t.co/2UDUiQwLWc #coronavirus https://t.co/jcfuNGT5w7

75 years ago, the UN was created to bring countries together to face global challenges. 

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, global cooperation is more important than ever. 

See how we are helping to tackle the #coronavirus: https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 #UN75 https://t.co/DgrvigWyo4

"Human rights are critical in shaping inclusive and effective responses to #COVID19." -- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet. 

Details in new #coronavirus report: https://t.co/wwg9Z8H7uD #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/X2Y3e0NwnA

As #COVID19 spreads around the world, the UN & partners are working to prevent the pandemic from putting displaced people who are trapped in humanitarian crises at further risk. 

https://t.co/ojooPbY9ro

Every 2 minutes, a child dies of malaria. 

Alongside efforts to tackle #COVID19, countries should seek to ensure that other killer disease, such as malaria, are safely treated, says @WHO.

Saturday is #WorldMalariaDay. https://t.co/aHLHOOJM6S https://t.co/fKD2yM2nga

Amid #COVID19, the UN continues its partnership with delegates from all over the world, working for a world where everyone thrives in peace, dignity and equality on a healthy planet.

Saturday is International Delegates Day. https://t.co/Wt3s6JS7Lz https://t.co/sNRpLkk4K7

👏 Clapping
 🎶 Music
🍳Cooking

Simple acts of solidarity can give hope to people around the world amid the #COVID19 pandemic. Get inspired by our @Twitter moment. 

https://t.co/WrII8F7Zoy

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.

Get the FACTS here: https://t.co/aZNBNhNjia https://t.co/BAW5zJ8JrF

.@antonioguterres calls for development of safe and effective #COVID19 vaccine & treatment that are affordable, easily-administered and available to everyone, everywhere. https://t.co/3q02tY06FQ https://t.co/C8ADV6oB4i

Ramadan Kareem!

As Muslims around the world begin observing #Ramadan, the UN family sends wishes of peace, compassion and solidarity.

https://t.co/3zjCpVxSOp

"The #coronavirus knows no borders and is a quintessential global challenge.  Combatting it requires us to work together as one human family."

-- @antonioguterres on Friday's #DiplomacyDay. https://t.co/OBvDmEqOZn https://t.co/my8E4pCrD7

Despite ongoing tensions, #COVID19 pandemic has resulted in inspiring examples of cooperation between Israelis & Palestinians, @nmladenov tells Security Council, urging leaders to seize moment to take steps towards peace. https://t.co/nkNh0fWdVh

People with autism should never face discrimination when seeking medical care.

#StandUp4HumanRights amid the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/9VIsDiVmHX #AutismAwareness https://t.co/whPSgljbki

With around 1.6 billion children unable to attend school in person due to #COVID19, @UNICEF is finding ways to keep them learning at home through online tools & targeted e-learning resources. https://t.co/uzjboVwmYl https://t.co/QyVg9QRbDR

In these difficult circumstances, #Ramadan is a time for peace, compassion and supporting the most vulnerable. 

Ramadan Kareem to all celebrating! https://t.co/p1rzu2xtjn

People — and their rights — must be front and centre in #COVID19 response and recovery efforts, says @antonioguterres in new report. https://t.co/hJyVGaI9DU #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/AZTatC9eAK

People at home are increasingly turning to books for entertainment & comfort amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

Thursday's #WorldBookDay is an opportunity to celebrate the importance of books in our lives. https://t.co/O6UAFm62Sw via @UNESCO https://t.co/F68iI7Gwzw

.@ITU online dialogue aims to inspire girls & young women to take up careers in technology on Thursday's #GirlsinITC Day.

Special focus will be on the need for role models & mentors to empower girls for future success in the tech field. https://t.co/qQMMOFy1ja https://t.co/EJXhgnbkAh

English is one of the 2 working languages and 6 official languages of the UN. 

On Thursday's English Language Day, get our latest updates on #COVID19 & more in English here. ⬇️ https://t.co/2zxrPajoby

"On this #EarthDay, please join me in demanding a healthy and resilient future for people and planet alike."

Countries around the world have joined @antonioguterres' call for #ClimateAction.

https://t.co/p4SGMAlyiE

As hopes for a life after #COVID19 start to take shape, the UN is focusing on how the crisis can be leveraged to build a better, more sustainable & inclusive future for all. #EarthDay
https://t.co/bIU4UguVWQ

With #COVID19 and the climate emergency demanding collective global action, the UN joined people around the world in celebrating #EarthDay from their homes on Wednesday.

https://t.co/Nn5hmRDsZv

Tobacco use can increase the risk of getting #COVID19.

🚭 Placing tobacco in your mouth can introduce virus into body.
🚭 Sharing tobacco products can transmit virus between people.
🚭 Tobacco can weaken your respiratory system.

More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/UDVIrUdH8K https://t.co/Pg5M5NgnUR

On Wednesday's #EarthDay, learn about our planet from a new perspective.

The "Mind the Earth" virtual exhibit uses satellite imagery to highlight the challenges of the climate crisis, while providing ideas for #ClimateAction solutions: https://t.co/40DCQQqBhS https://t.co/49LSrqVmwt

Last 5 years were the hottest on record, says @WMO report on Wednesday's #EarthDay.

We need science & solidarity to flatten the curve - for both #COVID19 and the climate crisis. https://t.co/1Cad9yCUeS https://t.co/uFQ8NLUkSx

We need to turn the #COVID19 recovery into a real opportunity to do things right for the future.

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's #EarthDay https://t.co/Q6kpAZxBak https://t.co/bHsdy9CxO5

Half of the children who are out of school due to #COVID19 don't have access to a computer.

@UNESCO's Global Education Coalition shares distance learning solutions to help students continue their education amid the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/0JaMook36l https://t.co/ceD9pVulYO

Children may be out of school due to #COVID19, but there are still many ways for them to continue learning.

Wednesday's #EarthDay is an opportunity for them to find out more about the climate crisis & become inspired to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/aUlL2XblK1 via @UNICEF https://t.co/09KMZ8GIF4

"It is critical we come together as one united global community to defeat this disease." 

-- @WFPChief stresses need for unity as world faces dual threat of global health pandemic & humanitarian catastrophe amid #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/DijUIGVJOO

#COVID19 is a stark reminder of the vulnerability of humans and the planet in the face of global threats.

On Wednesday's #EarthDay, @UNEP explains why the need for #ClimateAction is as urgent as ever.  
https://t.co/vdKx4iMyKP

The UN is working to prevent the spread of #COVID19 among densely populated & disaster-prone regions in south & south-east Asia to prevent further human suffering among the region's vulnerable populations. 

https://t.co/nVwiztvyJb

From developing online learning programmes for children to sharing vital #COVID19 information to help people stay safe, the UN works around the world to help countries tackle the #coronavirus crisis.
 
https://t.co/zJGd4yzz0p

As the #COVID19 pandemic highlights the value of online connectivity, new webinar series explores importance of digital cooperation amid #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/QfTLlNhEWc via @ITU https://t.co/AyZSt2xcrR

#COVID19 could push 265 million people into acute hunger by the end of 2020.

Food assistance programmes from @WFP and partners offer a vital lifeline for vulnerable people around the world. https://t.co/RKAZtXRZXG https://t.co/t1BKygl8NJ

.@WHO and partners are teaming-up with telecommunications companies to send vital health messages about #COVID19 to people's mobile phones.

The text messages will reach billions of people who don’t have direct internet access. https://t.co/oXvSWdFNaw https://t.co/FNYglwHyu5

Ahead of Wednesday's #EarthDay, join @UNDP's #Mission1Point5 mobile game from home and choose #ClimateAction policies to keep global warming below 1.5°C. https://t.co/M3ovbcKRbk https://t.co/DBE1lY90x7

From #COVID19 to the #GlobalGoals & #ClimateAction, creativity & innovation are needed to tackle the world's biggest challenges. 

See how the UN is harnessing solutions for the #coronavirus response & more on Tuesday's World Creativity & Innovation Day. https://t.co/jiNNQtm4qH https://t.co/kAiyOJzfg5

From solidarity concerts to standing ovations for doctors, acts of kindness continue to spread around the globe amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

Get inspired, by these examples in our @Twitter moment.
https://t.co/ML8e1JvIoX

#COVID19 has disrupted billions of lives & endangered the global economy. 

As the #coronavirus crisis wreaks havoc on labour markets worldwide, the UN is calling for a global response to support livelihoods. 

https://t.co/gIMcEgDmGM

New data from people in 186 countries indicates overwhelming public support for global cooperation, especially amid #COVID19 crisis. 

More from #UN75 survey ➡️ https://t.co/dz4VxuSFmg https://t.co/5Ri7NJiaha

"Now is the time to step up together, to prevent needless suffering & to fulfil the promise of a better future for all."

-- UN humanitarian chiefs have issued an urgent call to fund the global emergency supply system to fight #COVID19. https://t.co/79JzY80ngm #coronavirus https://t.co/uOnyITq8OB

New @IFAD Goodwill Ambassadors @IdrisElba & Sabrina Dhowre Elba launch appeal for $200 million #COVID19 relief fund for rural communities.

They are calling for action to prevent economic shocks from triggering a global hunger & food crisis. https://t.co/UHkWoOD7EC https://t.co/c2SpSJSmMc

Media & political leaders who have inflamed the rise of xenophobia and racial hatred amid the #COVID19 pandemic are "entrepreneurs of intolerance", says @UNHumanRights independent expert Tendayi Achiume. 

Our latest podcast 🎧. 
 
https://t.co/uqVWdS4Syu

With the world's attention is focussed on the fight against #COVID19, @UNOCHA highlights 10 ongoing humanitarian crises that need continued support amid the pandemic. 
https://t.co/dG8n53fJWY

60% of all infectious diseases in humans are zoonotic, which means they are transferred to us via animals.

@UNEP explains how human activities can cause zoonotic diseases. https://t.co/RlHwasjRBl https://t.co/Yqi9SxEEOF

UN colleagues are donating medical supplies to a local hospital in NYC in support of the #COVID19 response. 

See other ways the UN is helping to tackle #coronavirus around the world: https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/lUffPZQGiw

联合国中文日快乐 - Monday is Chinese language day.

Get our Chinese-language updates on #COVID19 & more here: https://t.co/UFhTvARBZe https://t.co/HRnXFnHKLE

Art can provide comfort in times of crisis, including amid the #COVID19 pandemic. 

@VoicesofYouth invites young people around the world to share illustrations that highlight the importance of supporting each other & taking care of your mental health. https://t.co/AqJveA0ibM

.@WHO plays a critical role in tackling the #COVID19 pandemic, by:
🔹 helping countries prepare & respond 
🔹 providing accurate information
🔹 supplying front line workers around the world
🔹 training health workers 
🔹 searching for a vaccine

https://t.co/XBECrePZMv

The #coronavirus crisis has led to a rise of harmful stereotypes. Preventing stigma is important in the fight against #COVID19.

Be kind and spread compassion. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/vQrFFI2YcN

In war-torn Yemen, amid the fear of #COVID19, Aisha delivered healthy triplets, in a @UNFPA-supported hospital.
Read her extraordinary story: https://t.co/G9PoVwgSg6 https://t.co/6ufUyIpFn1

New data shows that violence against women and girls has intensified since amid the #COVID19 crisis. 

Yet, violence against women is preventable, even during the #coronavirus pandemic.  @UN_Women explains: https://t.co/CxZiDRlQNW https://t.co/4QDMEbzKHv

For 75 years, the UN has brought countries, communities and people together to face global challenges - and is now at the forefront of the fight against #COVID19.

More on #UN75: https://t.co/jWlwtqXf1F https://t.co/LWFNg6gHXI

“The global pandemic highlights the vital importance of a safe, clean, healthy & sustainable environment.”

-- @UNHumanRights independent expert warns that #COVID19 must not be used as an excuse to weaken environmental protection. https://t.co/cZrWrgttDU #ClimateAction https://t.co/QCBEvHdkoO
Coming up: @antonioguterres joins @GlblCtzn One World: #TogetherAtHome broadcast in support of #COVID19 frontline health workers & @WHO: https://t.co/YeZkuNSxfl https://t.co/bZElw8qQxY

The #COVID19 pandemic is a global health crisis that requires a global response through multilateral cooperation.

The #GlobalGoals are our roadmap to recovery: https://t.co/xhDC9tQEd6 https://t.co/BaqXHJy4e1

⚒ Building quarantine facilities in Bangladesh
🔬 Providing testing kits in Nigeria
😷 Helping produce face masks in Tajikistan

The UN is working around the globe to help tackle the #COVID19 pandemic. See examples of our efforts in the @Twitter moment.
https://t.co/esEfbp9rT4

Women with #COVID19 can breastfeed if they wish to do so.

Remember to:

✔️ Practice respiratory hygiene during feeding.
✔️ Wash hands before & after touching the baby.
✔️ Routinely clean & disinfect surfaces you touch.

More tips from @WHO: https://t.co/iwmCeaibEm https://t.co/IrObedjeoG

"Now is not the time to reduce the resources for the operations of @WHO or any other humanitarian organization in the fight against #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres. 

Full statement: https://t.co/PHAWL7A9OF https://t.co/gohZx0Sy6p

Saturday marks 74 years of the @CIJ_ICJ helping to maintain peace & security.

The International Court of Justice works to settle legal disputes between countries & gives advisory opinions in accordance with international law. https://t.co/EkVTjAXZPv https://t.co/OjaI81LD18

The UN lowered its flag at NYC Headquarters in a gesture of solidarity and in honour of those who have lost their lives to #COVID19. 

Details on how the UN is supporting the #coronavirus response around the world: https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/zhQ15b3V8p

📱 Virtual doctors
🤖 Temperature-taking robots
🛰️ Tracking drones

@UNDESA recommends governments make full use of digital technologies to confront #COVID19 & meet people's needs. https://t.co/fqrhDmlMrQ https://t.co/R1vsu98pW2

We are in this together - and we will get through this, together. 

The UN is working around the clock to help everyone, everywhere in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/kWwt5XFKnu

Organized criminal groups are trying to make money out of the #COVID19 crisis with falsified medical products.

Listen only to official advice and protect yourself and your loved ones. https://t.co/MbPxDLCZRw via @UNODC 

https://t.co/3CA0TS7wCj

In all our #COVID19 response efforts, we must focus on the most vulnerable and ensure that the rights of all people are protected.  

-- @antonioguterres at @IMFNews - @WorldBank Spring Meetings: https://t.co/HzNwM51I5L https://t.co/ikhSFuzjOF

#COVID19 pandemic must not be used as opportunity to target marginalized & vulnerable people, restrict civil society and increase police powers, warns @UNAIDS. https://t.co/KUuOJ9U0GY https://t.co/TrDKl8ts7O

See inspiring examples of kindness and solidarity in the face of #COVID19 crisis in our latest @Twitter moment. 
https://t.co/cKoDDhdHAv

The #COVID19 crisis has caused significant disruptions worldwide, and has severely impacted children's safety, well-being & future.

@UNICEF calls for swift global action to protect the most vulnerable children from the impact of #coronavirus. https://t.co/nUENiuh0sL https://t.co/eIvZEFnSrK

“Yemen cannot face two fronts at the same time: a war and a pandemic."

-- @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council the country needs an end to conflict to focus on fighting #COVID19.
https://t.co/mQsMQf9n5H
